definition: to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse

sentences.english: From its formation we can easily define it refers to both double negative sentence and imperative sentence.
sentences.chinese: 仅从形式上看，它就与双重否定句和祈使句都有交叉。

sentences.english: Can you tell me what kind of sentence can be called imperative sentence?
sentences.chinese: 你能告诉我什么样的句子可以称作祈使句吗？

sentences.english: You use some question tags to make imperatives more polite.
sentences.chinese: 反意疑问句也用以使祈使句更礼貌。

sentences.english: You'll also notice another feature of these examples of the imperative is that there is no subject.
sentences.chinese: 同时你可能也会注意到，这些祈使句是没有主语的。

sentences.english: Note that the subject is omitted in commands, so the verb comes first.
sentences.chinese: 请留意在祈使句中主语省略，谓语动词前置。

sentences.english: Some grammarians believe that the subject of any imperative is the addressee.
sentences.chinese: 有的语法家还提出了祈使句的主语都是受话者。

sentences.english: Do be sure to come on time next time.
sentences.chinese: 译为“务必”，“一定”或在祈使句末尾加上呼语。

sentences.english: In English, the subject NP of an imperative sentence can be deleted.
sentences.chinese: 在英语中，这个主题党的祈使句可以删除。

sentences.english: You go and tell him not to do that.
sentences.chinese: 祈使句最常用于表达命令，因此也常称为命令句。

sentences.english: The mediaeval times were the crucial period to imperative sentence to develop to its maturity and stereotypes.
sentences.chinese: 中古是祈使句走向成熟与定型的关键时期。

sentences.english: Use imperative sentences when giving instructions.
sentences.chinese: 在给予指示的时候多使用祈使句。
